description: From Middle English throstle, throstel, from Old English þrostle, from Proto-Germanic *þrustlō, possibly altered from or a diminutive of *þurstaz, related to *þrastuz, from Proto-Indo-European *trosdos.
Cognate with German Drossel, Old Saxon throsla, Old High German droscala.
The spinning machine is named for the songbird, from the sound made when it is working.

entries.meaning: A machine for spinning wool, cotton, etc., from the rove, consisting of a set of drawing rollers with bobbins and flyers, and differing from the mule in having the twisting apparatus stationary and the processes continuous.
